name: IIIT Delhi
highlights: Established in 2008, Indraprastha Institute of Information Technology, Delhi (also known as IIIT Delhi or IIIT-D) is a state-level institute which initially started with its first batch of 60 students. The main campus of the institute is located in Okhla and it is approved by the University Grants Commission (UGC). IIIT Delhi is also a member of the Association of Indian Universities (AIU) and accredited by the NAAC with Grade 'A'. The institute is funded by the Government of Delhi and it ensures administrative and academic autonomy. Delhi IIIT has set up an R&D lab in collaboration with IRISYS Corporation Limited, South Korea. Indraprastha Institute of Information Technology has slipped down to rank 85 under the 'Engineering' category of the NIRF Rankings 2024.

name: DTU
highlights: Delhi Technological University is ranked 66th by NIRF 2024 under the Overall category, 48th by NIRF 2024 under the University category, and 27th by NIRF 2024 under the Engineering category. Formerly known as Delhi College of Engineering, Delhi Technological University (DTU) was established in 1941. DTU Delhi is accredited by the NAAC with an 'A' grade and NBA and is also approved by the University Grant Commission (UGC) and AICTE. The university is ISO-certified and earlier was affiliated with the University of Delhi. DTU University Delhi offers placement support to students and is visited by top companies such as Samsung, Microsoft, Zomato, and others. Delhi Technical University has a state-of-the-art infrastructure with multiple facilities available on the campus.
admissionProcess:
DTU admission process 2025 is both entrance-based and merit-based. Candidates must visit the official for application details. Delhi Technological University, Delhi offers various undergraduate, postgraduate and doctoral-level programmes. Some of the courses are Master of Arts (M.A.), Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA) and Bachelor of Technology (BTech). Bachelor of Technology is its most popular programme.
Admission to BTech is based on JEE Main scores, and the entire process of counselling is conducted by the Joint Admission Committee (JAC). Delhi Technological University admission to all the remaining courses is based on national/ university-level entrance exams, such as UCEED, GATE, CAT, MAT, and CMAT, among others. However, there are a few MBA specialised courses and BBA, admission to which is offered based on the past qualifying exam (UG level) followed by an interview round at Delhi Technological University, Delhi. DTU admissions are both merit and entrance-based.

name: NSUT
highlights: NSUT also known as Netaji Subhas University of Technology is a state-level university. NSIT was established in 1983 and in 2018 the institute was given university status, hence making it a non-affiliating university. Earlier it was affiliated with the University of Delhi. NSUT Delhi is recognised by the UGC and AICTE. NSIT Delhi University ranked 2nd under the TIMES All India Engineering Institutes Ranking Survey 2024. NSUT Delhi offers undergrdaute, postgraduate, and PhD courses across various streams such as Engineering, Management, Architecture, and others. The flagship courses offered at NSIT are BTech and MBA. Netaji Subhas University of Technology course admissions is based on merit and entrance exam scores.

placements:
The University has released the placement statistics for the 2024 batch of BTech, MTech, MBA, and other courses. The highest and average packages offered during NSUT placements 2024 were INR 1 crore per annum and INR 17.75 LPA, respectively. Over 320 companies from diverse sectors participated in the 2024 recruitment drive. This includes over 80 new recruiters. The majority of the participating companies were from the Tech sector. A large share of offers made during Netaji Subhas University of Technology placements 2024 was in the Tech sector.
Link to placement record: Click here
scholarships:
Scholarships comprising the tuition fee component of the overall fees of that academic year will be awarded every year to the top 5% students of each branch of academic programs being offered by the University. Selection will be based upon aggregate marks in the academic year and will be subject to the condition that the student has passed in all subjects in the academic year in the first attempt.
Students getting any scholarships from any other source(s) will not be entitled for scholarship under these rules. The expenses for scholarship shall be met from the plan scheme of the University.
